intro: Coccocypselum hispidum, commonly known as the hairy coccocypselum, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
